name: Data Profiling and Descriptive Analysis
content:
Data Profiling

To ensure data quality and reliability, the following checks are performed on the trading dataset:

  • Summary Statistics → Assess central tendency, spread, and data distribution.
  • Missing Values → Identify and handle gaps in data.
  • Outlier Detection → Spot extreme values that may bias analysis or models.
  • Consistency Checks → Validate business logic (e.g., no negative prices/volumes).
  • Duplicate Records → Detect and resolve duplicate entries.

Basic Feature Engineering

From raw stock trading data, the following derived features were created for deeper analysis and modeling:

  • Daily Change = Close − Open
  • High–Low Spread = High − Low
  • Daily Returns = (Close − Open) / Open
  • Moving Average (5D) = 5-day rolling average of Close price
  • Moving Average (10D) = 10-day rolling average of Close price
  • Volume Change = Daily change in trading volume

Descriptive Analysis

The following visualizations are generated to uncover patterns, volatility, and sector-level behaviors:

1.Stock Price Movements (Line Plot)

  • Closing prices over time by company.
  • Helps detect trends, seasonal cycles, or irregular behaviors.

2.Volume Changes Over Time (Line Plot)

  • Trading volume trends per company.
  • Identifies spikes or drops linked to events or market activity.

3.Box Plot of Daily Returns by Sector

  • Summarizes volatility across sectors.
  • Spread and median highlight stability vs risk in Technology, Finance, and Healthcare.

4.Distribution of Daily Changes (Histogram/Density Plot)

  • Captures intra-day price movement distribution.
  • Reveals volatility patterns across companies.

5.Correlation Heatmap

  • Shows interdependence among features.
  • Example: Strong correlation between Open & Close → lower volatility;
  • Correlation between Volume & Daily Change → possible volume-driven price movement.
